examples: Just to, pronunciation? - Diacritical, knowing where to stress, because of the layout of the screen that contains our clues, some words that should be together are separated, one on one line, the other on another line, and sometimes just naturally we tend to pause at the end of a line.
words.defineEn: capable of distinguishing
words.defineVi: có khả năng phân biệt

words.defineEn: so thin as to transmit light
words.defineVi: quá mỏng để truyền ánh sáng

examples: They're going to bond and form these diatomic molecules.
Nitrogen in the air exists as elemental diatomic nitrogen, and hydrogen, likewise, is also diatomic H2.

First, the oxidation number for any element by itself, whether it's monatomic, diatomic, or polyatomic, like an atom of calcium or molecule of H2 or even bigger molecule of sulfur (S8), the oxidation number is 0.
So there's a bond right here, and this is why hydrogen is a diatomic molecular gas, and this is why iodine is the same.

Regular oxygen gas is made of two oxygens bound to each other, but when an energetic photon of light hits it just right they’ll break apart, and those individual oxygens will go bind with another diatomic oxygen forming a molecule of ozone.
words.defineEn: of or relating to a molecule made up of two atoms
words.defineVi: của hoặc liên quan đến một phân tử được tạo thành từ hai nguyên tử

words.defineEn: a harsh and severe criticism or verbal attack that is aimed toward a person or thing

words.defineEn: extremely evil or cruel; expressive of cruelty or befitting hell

examples: Do you see how that could seem strange or incongruous?
Do you see how that could seem strange or incongruous to a viewer?
words.defineEn: peculiar and not like what is considered suitable or appropriate for a situation
words.defineVi: đặc biệt và không giống như những gì được coi là phù hợp hoặc thích hợp cho một tình huống

examples: I'm watching one man struggle with his search for Tom Petty, which is so inconsequential because when are you gonna do this information?
But it’s a mistake to dismiss him as inconsequential.
And over the last few cycles, what we have seen is a Senate that gets nothing done, unless it's confirming judges or voting on inconsequential legislation.
words.defineEn: without any significance or importance
words.defineVi: không có bất kỳ ý nghĩa hoặc tầm quan trọng

examples: I try to be as inconspicuous as possible when doing this.
words.defineEn: not prominent or readily noticeable
words.defineVi: không nổi bật hoặc dễ dàng nhận thấy

examples: I do not know what the interpreter said, but under no circumstances did I mean that I had a problem with you, not by any stretch of the imagination.

So many protests, so many protests do not have interpreters.
Finally, interpreters work in pairs.
I love that interpreter.
words.defineEn: someone who verbally changes the words of a language into another
words.defineVi: ai đó bằng lời nói thay đổi các từ của một ngôn ngữ sang một ngôn ngữ khác

examples: They're interrogating the chief in this little village here.

They interrogated him and asked him: What are you doing here?
Interrogating the evidence our online sources provide us is incredibly important.
As they interrogate their prisoner, it's pretty obvious that there are a lot of other people here.
words.defineEn: to question someone in an aggressive way for a long time in order to get information
words.defineVi: để đặt câu hỏi cho ai đó một cách tích cực trong một thời gian dài để có được thông tin

examples: I'm not coercing them.
The dealers' descendants say the sale was coerced.
The dealers' descendants say the sale was coerced.
We don't coerce or compromise your independence.
Here's the truth about slavery: It was coerced labor that relied upon intimidation and brutality and dehumanization.
words.defineEn: to cause to do through pressure or necessity, by physical, moral or intellectual means
words.defineVi: gây ra để làm thông qua áp lực hoặc sự cần thiết, bằng phương tiện thể chất, đạo đức hoặc trí tuệ

examples: And there should be no intimidation, no coercion, no threats, no anti-union propaganda.

At the same time, these national states developed the economic institutions to extract revenue to pay for this coercion, which allowed the state to flourish.
words.defineEn: using force to cause something to occur
words.defineVi: sử dụng vũ lực để gây ra một cái gì đó xảy ra

examples: The outcome of the court case will make or mar the future of the business.
The failure to address the issue in a timely manner had made or marred the team's chances of winning the championship.
The man had gotten married at a young age and struggled to balance his personal and professional responsibilities, recognizing that a young man married is a young man marred.
The president was vacationing in Mar-a-Lago, and didn't want to talk about the virus.
In December of 2017, he wins a presidential race that was marred by very credible allegations of fraud.
words.defineEn: make imperfect
words.defineVi: làm cho không hoàn hảo

examples: Well, President Trump is furious at the idea that his marred legacy became even more tarnished today, as he became the first Britain to be impeached twice.
Well, President Trump is furious at the idea that his marred legacy became even more tarnished today, as he became the first Britain to be impeached twice.
Many of us are in the arena, where, as Teddy Roosevelt would say, we're marred and bloody.
words.defineEn: blemished by injury or rough wear
words.defineVi: vết thâm do chấn thương hoặc mặc thô

examples: North Korea’s refusal had long been a sticking point.

examples: This afternoon, in Georgia, Gabriel Sterling, a top state elections official, refuted the president's allegations of fraud.

Hard determinism is tough to refute.
words.defineEn: overthrow by argument, evidence, or proof
words.defineVi: lật đổ bằng lập luận, bằng chứng hoặc bằng chứng

examples: He investigated and put an end to the rumors by publishing a thorough, scientific refutation.
words.defineEn: the act of determining that something is false
words.defineVi: hành động xác định rằng một cái gì đó là sai

words.defineEn: the use of similar vowels close to each other in nonrhyming syllables as a literary device

words.defineEn: having the same vowel sound occurring with different consonants in successive words or stressed syllables

words.defineEn: correspond in vowel sounds; rhyme in assonance
words.defineVi: tương ứng trong nguyên âm; vần đồng âm
